evidence.source_document: Plaintiffs’ Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text: On April 4, thirteen plaintiffs in this action moved for a temporary restraining order seeking immediate relief with respect to a subset of their claims, see ECF No. 8, with the intention of subsequently moving for a preliminary injunction on all

extracted.value: Plaintiffs (thirteen parties from Massachusetts, California, Maryland, Washington, Arizona, Delaware, Hawaiʻi, and others) filed a Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order on April 4, 2025, seeking immediate relief to restrain certain alleged actions and requesting the court to grant the restraining order.

evidence.source_document: Assented-To Motion to Set a Briefing Schedule on Plaintiffs’ Motion for a Preliminary Injunction and Notice of Withdrawal of Plaintiffs’ Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text: On April 8, 2025  Respectfully submitted.  ANDREA JOY CAMPBELL  ROB BONTA  Attorney General of Massachusetts  Attorney General of California  /s/ Gerard J. Cedrone  /s/ Emilio V  ...  withdraw their motion for a temporary restraining order (ECF No. 8) without prejudice to any arguments raised in the motion and reserving all rights

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed an Assented‑to Motion to Set a Briefing Schedule on their Preliminary Injunction motion and withdrew their earlier Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order on April 8, 2025, with the withdrawal made without prejudice to their arguments.

evidence.source_document: Time Sensitive Motion for Stay Pending Appeal and Immediate Administrative Stay
evidence.text: MEMORANDUM in Support re 8 Emergency MOTION for Temporary Restraining Order filed by State of Nevada, State of New Jersey, State of New York, State of Oregon, State of Rhode Island, State of Wisconsin, Commonwealth of Massachusetts, State of California, State of Maryland, State of Washington, State of Arizona, State of Delaware, State of Hawaii. (Cedrone, Gerard) (Entered: 04/04/2025)

extracted.value: On April 4, 2025, a coalition of thirteen states—including Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Oregon, Rhode Island, Wisconsin, Massachusetts, California, Maryland, Washington, Arizona, Delaware, and Hawaii—filed an Emergency Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order (Time Sensitive Motion for Stay Pending Appeal) to seek an immediate stay pending appeal.

evidence.text: Defendants’ Motion to Dismiss ... Filed 06/20/25  ... Defendants move to dismiss Plaintiffs’ complaint with respect to all unreasonable delay/phase 2 claims for the reasons set forth in the accompanying memorandum of points and authorities.

extracted.value: Defendants (Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and associated agencies) filed a Motion to Dismiss on June 20, 2025, asking the court to dismiss Plaintiffs’ complaint with respect to unreasonable delay/phase 2 claims.

evidence.source_document: Motion for a Stay of the Court's June 23 Partial Judgment
evidence.text: MOTION FOR A STAY OF THE COURT’S JUNE 23 PARTIAL JUDGMENT  For the reasons stated in Defendants’ Memorandum in Support, Defendants respectfully request that the Court stay pending appeal the Court’s June 23, 2025, orders and partial final judgments, States Doc No. 151 and APHA Doc No. 143, or for a stay of at least 14 days so that Defendants may seek a stay pending appeal from the First Circuit.

extracted.value: Defendants (including the American Public Health Association) filed a Motion for a Stay of the Court’s June 23, 2025 Partial Judgment on June 23, 2025, requesting the court to stay pending appeal the court’s orders and partial final judgments.
